timeline.message:
Hotfix Release 1.5.4 - Merge to Master (#1083)

* Update submodule to master@2.0.12

* Update version to 1.5.4

* Update gradle deps to 2.0.12

* Update changelog

MSAL Release 1.5.5 (#1104)

* Update submodule pointer to common@2.0.14

* Update version.properties

* Update changelog

* Update dependencies

* Update common submodule pointer to common@2.0.12-hf1

* Update changelog for hf versioning

* Update dependency for common@2.0.12-hf1

timeline.bodyText: Did common already merge to dev? Can we change this to point to SNAPSHOT version?
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Common doesn't need to merge to dev for this release, because it is already ahead of this release (we have already deployed 2.0.13, this release shipped 2.0.12-hf1 which doesn't contain all of those changes)
replies.author: iambmelt

replies.bodyText: (This is to say, there shouldn't be any more 2.0.12-hf1 snapshots unless I am missing something?)
replies.author: iambmelt

replies.bodyText: Yup, there wont be any  2.0.12-hf1 snapshots since common dev is at 2.0.14 - so we can change to 2.0.14-SNAPSHOT  for the nightly builds here
replies.author: kreedula
iambmelt

replies.bodyText:
I am fine either ways, typically we update this when doing an MSAL release (i.e. we always have a newest common). This is weird case with hotfix.

We can leave it at 2.0.12-hf1 as it's the latest common MSAL is consuming in maven central or
Given it's dev branch and we updating it with latest common makes sense too.
replies.author: kreedula

replies.bodyText: @shahzaibj @kreedula Let's go ahead and rev this version to 2.0.14-SNAPSHOT and 2.0.14 respectively. Even still, this state will be short-lived, as these will both be updated to 2.0.15 next week for the regularly scheduled release of 1.5.6 (or 1.6.0, depending on the contents of changes)
replies.author: iambmelt
